questions.question_text: Which technology is used as the basis for the Cisco SD-Access data plane?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
In Cisco's SD-Access, VXLAN is utilized to overlay virtual networks across the existing IP infrastructure, enabling segmentation, policy enforcement, and simplified network provisioning.

Selected Answer: C
VXLAN is correct

questions.question_text: How is OAuth framework used in REST API?

choices.C: as a framework to hide the security information in the REST URL
choices.B: by providing the external application a token that authorizes access to the account
choices.A: as a framework to hash the security information in the REST URL
choices.D: by providing the user credentials to the external application

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
OAuth (Open Authorization) is a framework that allows third-party applications to access a user's resources on a server without the user sharing their credentials directly with the application. In the context of REST APIs, OAuth is commonly used to provide secure authorization for API access.

Selected Answer: B
The threat defense REST API uses Oauth 2.0 for authenticating calls from API clients. OAuth is an access token-based method, and the threat defense uses JSON web tokens for the schema.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/firepower/ftd-api/guide/ftd-rest-api/auth-ftd-rest-api.pdf

questions.question_text: What is a characteristic of Cisco DNA southbound APIs?

choices.A: implements monitoring by using the SOAP protocol
choices.B: enables orchestration and automation of network devices based on intent

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
B and D sound more or less the same but because of the keyword 'intent' I chose D - Intent API is northbound.

Selected Answer: D
North Bound APIs are intent based.
Southbound APIs are made for device management. (Vendor neutral/agnostic)

The correct answer is definitivly D
B is wrong s. Reference: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/cloud-systems-management/network-automation-and-management/dna-center-platform/2-3-7/user-guide/b-dnac-platform-ug-2-3-7/b-dnac-platform-ug-2-3-7-chapter-01.html#id_76824
"The Intent APIs are Northbound REST APIs that expose specific capabilities of Cisco DNA Center platform. The Intent APIs provide policy-based abstraction of business intent, allowing you to focus on an outcome to achieve instead of struggling with the mechanisms that implement that outcome. "

Selected Answer: D
D looks accurate

Selected Answer: B
Simplifying Management (Option D): This is a broad benefit of the entire Cisco DNA solution, including both its northbound and southbound APIs. The simplification comes from the combination of many features like automation, policy enforcement, and monitoring. However, it doesn't pinpoint the specific technical role that southbound APIs play.

Orchestration and Automation (Option B): This is a precise description of what southbound APIs are designed to do in Cisco DNA. They translate intents into actionable configurations on the network devices, thus enabling automated orchestration based on predefined policies.

Selected Answer: B
the computer says B
I got C -- Utilizes Rest API (Chat GPT) which kind of aligns with some of the other questions any reason it cant be C?

comments.content: REST is a Northbound API, in general, any SBI's in this exam will be NETCONF.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Considering this from the OCG page 820:
"Southbound API
If a network operator makes a change to a switch’s configuration in the management 
 software of the controller, those changes are then pushed down to the individual devices 
by using a Southbound API. These devices can be routers, switches, or even wireless access 
points. APIs interact with the components of a network through the use of a programmatic 
interface."
Both B and D make sense, but I'll go with the option B.

Selected Answer: D
This has to be D, B inclines to NB APIs
D is more apt. It's to manage NW devices. As simple as that.

Select Answer D
B is not correct because Northbound—Intent APIs
Intent APIs enable developers to access Cisco DNA Center Automation and Assurance workflows. Through this access, you can simplify the process of creating workflows that consolidate multiple network actions.

Selected Answer: B
B makes sense to me

Southbound is primarily aimed at non-Cisco "thirdparty" devices!

Northbound: Discovery and management of the network over REST API
Southbound: SDK integration into the DNA Center via device packs to support multivendor environment
Eastbound: Event / Notification Handler
Westbound: Integration of reporting, analysis, service management

Selected Answer: B
southbound api-s are used for communicating network devices - thinking B here

choices.C: The wireless LAN controller exists in the cloud.
choices.B: The wireless LAN controller is embedded into the access point.
choices.D: There is no wireless LAN controller in the network.
choices.A: The wireless LAN controller exists in a server that is dedicated for this purpose.

questions.question_text: Where is the wireless LAN controller located in a mobility express deployment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In a Cisco Mobility Express network, Access Point (AP) running the wireless controller function is designated as the primary AP - Answer B, since WLC lives in AP.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-2/b_Mobility_Express_Deployment_guide/b_Mobility_Express_Deployment_guide_chapter_01.html

comments.content:
yes, you are right, its B
i missunderstood question

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
B. The wireless LAN controller is embedded into the access point.

In a Cisco Mobility Express deployment, the wireless LAN controller functionality is embedded directly into one of the access points, which is designated as the "master" access point. This allows the network to function without the need for a separate physical wireless LAN controller device. The master access point manages and coordinates the activities of other access points in the network, providing centralized control for WLAN configuration, security, and management functions.

Selected Answer: B
Correct anwer is B

Selected Answer: A
i think the correct answer is A: because WLC should be on a server

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer must permit administrators to automatically authenticate if there is no response from either of the AAA servers. Which configuration achieves these results?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
"aaa authentication login default none" command to get access to Router via Console / VTY / AUX without authentication. 
"default" means ---> console/vty/aux
"none" means ---> no authentications
The "'none'" keyword enables any user logging in to successfully authenticate, it should be used only as a backup method of authentication.

Selected Answer: A
It says allow to authenticate if no radius. only option A has "local" as a fallback.

comments.content: Answer is D, see: https://community.cisco.com/t5/network-access-control/aaa-authentication-login-novice-question/td-p/93484 <== see option two

discussion.content: Something to think about in wordplay here. "permit administrators to authenticate" not permit them to login. In which case option A would be correct for granting EXEC-Mode.

comments.content: And that is the only option with "local"

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Router# show running-config
lines omitted for brevity
enable secret 5 Sdfefw525£fd$@LUL@D2d242€
username cisco password 0 cisco
aaa new-model
radius-server host 10.11.11.11 auth-port 1812 acct-port 1646
radius-server host 10.11.11.12 auth-port 1645 acct-port 1646 
radius-server key cisco123

Selected Answer: D
authenticates automatically a.k.a. no authentication

comments.content: And it's the only logical one that is of the type "login".

choices.C: aaa authentication login default group tacacs+ line
choices.B: aaa authentication login default group radius
choices.A: aaa authentication enable default group radius local
choices.D: aaa authentication login default group radius none
